column4: whats the best most easiest way in cmdline to reinstall ubuntu gnome desktop?
what other directories like .hidden should i remove as well?
what are you trying to acomplish exactly>?
that will just install, i said reinstall
are you sure its a system setting/gnome issue and not a user setting issue?
try adding a new user - see if it works for them
i dont want to add another user
its trivial.. but whatever.. move the users .whatever dirs to some othe rsubdir..  and test out gnome
You are trying to reinstall all of gnome. when it may be a simple user setting.
you could use metacity instead of compiz.  iF compiz is the issue.
ok,,, good point, which works better, and do they both load when i install
compiz is a widnow maanger with all the eyecandy. it requires the 3d video drivers.. metacity is the older gnome window manager. not as much eyecandy. You use one or the other.
then somthing may be wrong with them if they are not working with compiz. or they got disabled.
when i right click the desktop and change to desktop background and then visual effect, the 3rd option, is that Metacity?
alt-f2  run 'metacity --replace' to   be sure its using metacity
any effects will be using compiz with differnt settings. NONE = metacity
